interactivity.requirements: Saturday You must have seen or permanently missed the following Events: Seen Main Events up to " Danger to Society " Seen Happy Events up to " XVI " Seen " Worry Not, The Mason Jar " from Ami Arakawa Seen " Dizzy On The Comedown " from Ayane Amamiya Seen " Our Time Atop This Mattress " from Chika Chosokabe Seen " Fish Eyes " from Futaba Fukuyama Seen " Two Of Us Are Thinking " from Io Ichimonji Seen " Salmon Onigiri " from Kirin Kanda Seen " Suffer the Same " from Makoto Miyamura Seen " A Brutal, Violent Creaming " from Maya Makinami Seen " Rostrum of Recollection " from Miku Maruyama Seen " Sardines " from Molly MacCormack Seen " Lavender " from Nodoka Nagasawa Seen " Somewhere " or missed " NOWHERE " from Noriko Nakayama Seen " Breaking Character " from Otoha Okakura Seen " Ever Fallen In Love " from Rin Rokuhara Seen " Ad Infinitum " or missed " Gods Don't Smile Down " from Sana Sakakibara Seen " Under My Wing " from Touka Tsukioka Seen " Sudden Light " from Tsuneyo Tojo Seen " The Girl From Nara " from Uta Ushibori Seen " An Apple Each Day " from Yasu Yasui Seen " A Day in the Life " from Yumi Yamaguchi Seen " Bad News Bears " from Chinami Chosokabe Seen " Scum " or missed " Soap " from Haruka Hamasaki Seen " Debbie Downer " from Imani Imai Seen " Run, Rabbit, Run (Why the Fieldmice Hide) " from Kaori Kadowaki Seen " Wrong Places/Wrong Times " from Karin Kanda Seen " Rotting From the Inside Out " from Maki Miyamura Seen " Eternity Until " from Nao-chan Seen " Non-Disclosure Agreement " from Niki Nakayama Seen " House of the Unholy " from Osako Osaka Seen " James and the Giant Peach (Together-ish) " from Rika Rokuhara Seen " Nicolas Cage " from Sara Sakakibara Seen " The Lucky Few " from Tsubasa Tsukioka Seen " Jeeves Tsukioka XIII " from Tsukasa Tsukioka Seen " Follow My Lead " from Wakana Watabe Seen " Pride & Joy " from Yuki Yamaguchi
interactivity.to_get_this_event: Upon fulfilling all Requirements, this Event automatically occurs on the next available Saturday.

progression.synopsis: Something speaks to Sensei as he sleeps. While at first, its speech is nigh incomprehensible, it soon wishes him a Happy Halloween, telling him it hopes the mess of tonight will be easily swept up. It warns him that it'll be watching carefully tonight, for otherwise it would go blind, and the world would go dark as a result â€“ And while he might not mind such a life for himself , he wouldn't accept the same hurt being put on everyone else. Something knocks on Sensei's bedroom door, and he awakens to find Maya crouched down next to him. He's comforted by her presence, though still unused to seeing her smile so freely. As he continues to talk to her, specifically about all that's happened between them as of late , Maya becomes increasingly confused and worried, trying to leave and let Sensei get more sleep. When he insists she stays, and Maya tells him that she's "not who he thinks she is". Sensei fully wakes up and realizes the person he's been talking to is Ami , albeit in Maya's clothes. While he dismisses what he was saying as "dreamspeak", Ami still insists they skip tonight's Halloween Party and rest instead. Sensei refuses, immediately jumping out of bed and rushing into the living room. Sensei enters the living room with Ami, only to find Ayane who is also inexplicably dressed up as Maya. After a few impressions, the two reveal that they'll be dressing up as Maya tonight as both a bit of fun and as payback for Maya's first Halloween costume . On cue, Maya opens the front door, immediately annoyed upon seeing Ami and Ayane. This is exacerbated as both girls begin impersonating her once again, causing Maya to angrily demand they stop and put on their "real costumes". They both reveal that these are their "real costumes", while Ami subtly tries to pry out information about Sensei's "dreamspeak". Maya's taken aback by this sudden change in topic but drops the topic when Ami pretends she didn't say anything. Getting ready to leave, Ami steps away to grab her phone while Maya and Ayane express concern for Sensei, who's been unusually quiet all morning. He snaps out of his thoughts and insists he's fine, adding that he has been feeling weird since he woke up. Ayane expresses a similar sentiment, though Maya seems completely fine. Dropping this tangent, the two fill Sensei in on more details regarding tonight's proposed after-party , during which Maya reveals she'll be attempting to enjoy herself more thoroughly tonight rather than focus on details relating to resets. Ayane pokes fun at this sudden change in character as Ami returns to the group. The four of them begin the trip to Ayane's place once Sensei finishes getting dressed.
trivia: If Sensei does not have at least 50 Ami Lust , triggering this event will fail Family Matters !

Another Chain-Event will occur directly after this one, as such the player must also complete the following requirements before the start of this event. If Sensei does not have at least 60 Ami Lust , triggering this event will guarantee that The Caretaker is missed!
If Sensei does not have at least 60 Ami Lust , triggering this event will guarantee that The Caretaker is missed!
New picture messages from Kirin and Molly will be available following this Event.
Following this Chain-Event, Summer comes to an end and Chapter 3 will end. As such, it is recommended to make a save here in case you miss some Events in Chapter 3.

changelog: This Event was added in Update 0.35.
